description.narrative: (i) This Project is expected to generate new rural employment of 34 permanent and about 100 seasonal employees in Haryana and Punjab in three years. (ii) This Project is likely to create additional backward linkages with farmers as it is expected to increase procurement of basmati rice paddies from about 230,000 mt to 440,000 mt in three years, via "mandis" (markets) from farmers in various states. (iii) This Project is likely to create forward linkages with SME distributors as well. (iv) This Project will provide climate change benefits by adding 5 MW husk power generation capacity.

Dunar, headquartered in Karnal, India is in the business of procurement, processing and supply of basmati rice. The Company owns two production facilities in Karnal, Haryana (modernized in 1996) and Amritsar, Punjab (commissioned in March 2010). The processing capacity of Karnal facility is 26 tons per hour (tph), while that for Amritsar facility is 24 tph.
Dunar plans to invest in the expansion of its production capacity in Karnal from 26 tph to 50 tph during the next two years. It will also invest in additional silo capacity of 60,000 metric ton and rice husk-based power generation capacity of 3 MW in Karnal and a new rice husk-based power plant of 2 MW in Amritsar (in addition to the existing 1 MW capacity).

mailing-address.narrative: Mr. Surender Gupta Managing Director Dunar Foods Limited Near CWC, Vill. Bazida Jattan, Karnal 132001 Haryana, India Tel #: +91-184-2220 701 Fax#:+91 -184-2220 703 www.dunarbasmatirice.com

name.narrative: The Company owns two production facilities in Karnal, Haryana and Amritsar, Punjab where the Project will take place.

activity-description.narrative: A description that qualifies the activity taking place at the location.
